H0.text: 0.025 is the mechanical advantage of the screwdriver used to pry the lid off a paint can, with a resistance arm of 0.5 centimeters and an effort arm of 20 centimeters.

H1.text: The mechanical advantage of the screwdriver used to pry the lid off a paint can, with a resistance arm of 0.5 centimeters and an effort arm of 20 centimeters, is 10.

H2.text: 19.5 is the mechanical advantage of the screwdriver used to pry the lid off a paint can, where the resistance arm is 0.5 centimeters and the effort arm is 20 centimeters.

H3.text: 40 is the mechanical advantage of the screwdriver used to pry the lid off a paint can, where the resistance arm is 0.5 centimeters and the effort arm is 20 centimeters.

A4.text: The ideal mechanical advantage (IMA), or theoretical mechanical advantage, is the ratio of the force out of the machine (load) to the force into the machine (effort).
